job_title: Summer Camp Counsellor in Whitby, ON
pros: Amazing team, great experience, and lovely kids.
cons: Had a terrible counsellor lead but it was addressed by admin, and counsellors felt like they were heard.

job_title: Recreation Therapist CTRS in Whitby, ON
pros: Some pros include staff, accommodations, flexibility, inclusion
cons: Low compensation, lack of full time positions

review_title: This place isnt what it used to be.
pros: Enjoyed my coworker's company, the available inclusive equipment, programs, and accessibility is a huge plus, offers great programs.
cons: Very poor management. Cliquey, had favourites, and offered us no training but expected us to be fully competent in their policies and procedures and operations with no training. Inaccessible to employees. They treat disabled employees so poorly and don't hire many visible disabled people, they use them for free labor as volunteers. Another issue is the ASAD program. Flaherty would be rolling in his grave. It has expanded so much (because they need the $3k per student income) they have actually taken over space and program room for the adult day program forcing it to lose out on the life skills apartment as well as other opportunities it used to offer. Punished for not working for free or being able to volunteer my free time to complete work.
